sources.name: ILO Social Protection Department (2014)
sources.description:
Data published by Scheil-Adlung, Xenia (2014), Universal Health Protection: Progress to Date and the Way Forward, International Labour Organization.
Data publisher's source For OECD-member countries, OECD Health Data 2011. For other countries, various sources (mainly official country reports).
Link http://apps.who.int/medicinedocs/en/d/Js21558en/
Retrieved 2017-04-10

Estimate of health coverage as a percentage of total population. Coverage includes affiliated members of health insurance or estimation of the population having free access to health care services provided by the State. Consult detailed data and sources available from the original tables (http://www.social-protection.org/gimi/gess/RessourceDownload.action?ressource.ressourceId=37218) and the discussion paper (http://apps.who.int/medicinedocs/en/d/Js21558en/)

sources.name: OWID using ILO (2014) and OECD (2017)
sources.description:
ILO Data published by Scheil-Adlung, Xenia (2014), Universal Health Protection: Progress to Date and the Way Forward, International Labour Organization.
OECD Data published by OECD.Stat
Data publisher's source For OECD-member countries, OECD Health Data. For other countries, various sources (mainly official country reports).
Links

http://apps.who.int/medicinedocs/en/d/Js21558en/

http://stats.oecd.org/index.aspx?DataSetCode=HEALTH_STAT#
Retrieved 2017-04-10

This dataset combines observations for OECD countries from the 1960s, with observations for non-OECD countries from the 2000s. If you are interested in complete series please visit the underlying sources.

Estimate of health coverage as a percentage of total population. Coverage includes affiliated members of health insurance or estimation of the population having free access to health care services provided by the State. Consult detailed data and sources available from the original tables (http://www.social-protection.org/gimi/gess/RessourceDownload.action?ressource.ressourceId=37218) and the discussion paper (http://apps.who.int/medicinedocs/en/d/Js21558en/)

variables.name: Share of population covered by health insurance
variables.description: Percentage of the population covered by health insurance (members of health insurance or free access to health care services provided by the State)

variables.name: Total health care coverage (ILO and OECD selected years)
variables.description: Percentage of the population covered by health insurance (members of health insurance or free access to health care services provided by the State). Selected years.
